title: Article Posted on: Skyward Launches First Information Management Solution For Commercial Drone Operators
text:
Drones are rapidly becoming an important tool in the real estate industry. A recent study by the Association for Unmanned Vehicle Systems International found that real estate businesses accounted for nearly a third of the first 500 commercial drone permits granted by the Federal Aviation Administration. Showing properties with video taken from the air was the most popular use, and accounted for 153 of the early permits granted by the FAA. According to an analysis by Marchesello & Company, real estate is among the top 10 growing business segments for commercial drone use.
With applications for drones rapidly evolving, Skyward has introduced the first information management solution designed for commercial drone operators. By providing this critical business infrastructure,Skyward is powering a global aerial robotics network. The cloud-based solution integrates a drone airspace map with flight planning tools and a digital system of record, supported by a team of regulatory and operational experts.
“In the last year, I’ve seen the commercial drone market evolve rapidly, with over 1,400 FAA grants to date,” said Jonathan Evans, Skyward CEO. “Skyward gives those operators comprehensive tools to access the sky and meet their business objectives. Skyward is committed to powering the next generation of aviation.”
